snippet: Renny Vilorio has chronic asthma that puts him in the hospital seven or eight times a month, but he is determined to finish an associate degree in public administration.
abstract: Catholic Charities Archdiocese of New York, supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, draws $210 to buy school supplies for homeless man Renny Vilorio, who is pursuing college degree at Hostos Community College in Bronx while suffering from chronic, sometimes debilitating asthma.
lead_paragraph: Renny Vilorio has chronic asthma that puts him in the hospital seven or eight times a month, but he is determined to finish an associate degree in public administration.

headline.main: Pursuing a Degree While Balancing Chronic Illness and Classes
headline.print_headline: Pursuing a Degree While Balancing Classes and Chronic Illness
